Breakfast Burrito.name: Breakfast Burrito
instructions: Turn an oven on to 400 degrees Fahrenheit
Right afterwards, add the 2 strips of bacon (28 grmas) into the oven and cook until desired doneness
Heat a pan up to medium heat, then add in chorizo (80 grams)
Cook chorizo on pan for 15-20 minutes
Remove the chorizo from the pan
Dice up quarter of an onion
Add to saucepan and keep on medium heat for 5 minutes
Bring saucepan down to low heat
Mix the 4 eggs (150 grams) well
Add eggs to saucepan with diced onions (40 grams) and continuously mix the eggs
Once the eggs are set but still slightly watery, remove from saucepan
Cook the 6 tater tots (50 grams) by following instructions on the bag
Place the tortilla on a plate
Spread sour cream all over the tortilla
Add tater tots, eggs, cheddar cheese (28 grams), chorizo, and bacon to tortilla
Finish up and enjoy!
cooking tips: Put bacon into cold oven before heating
For soft scrambled eggs, constantly stir eggs with a spatula
Add jalapeno to eggs or hot sauce to burrito to increase the spiciness
Cook the onions in the rendered chorizo fat

Tater Tots: French fries and other fried white potatoes

queries.Egg: Eggs, Grade A, Large, egg whole

Croque Madame.name: Croque Madame
instructions: In a medium saucepan over medium heat, melt the 30 grams of butter
Add the 30 grams of flour and whisk continuously for 2-3 minutes. This creates a roux. Ensure it doesn't brown
Gradually pour in the 300 grams of whole milk, whisking constantly to prevent lumps
Bring the mixture to a simmer over medium heat, stirring regularly. The sauce will thicken
Season with salt, pepper, and a pinch of nutmeg and cheese
Reduce the heat to low and stir in the 60 grams of Gruyère cheese until melted and smooth
Keep the Mornay sauce warm
Preheat your oven to 220°C (430°F)
Brush both sides of the 2 slices of bread with the melted 20 grams of butter
Place them on a baking sheet and lightly toast them in the oven for about 3-5 minutes, or until golden
Spread a generous amount of the Mornay sauce on one side of each toasted bread slice
On one slice, layer half the grated Gruyère, the 150 grams of ham, and spread the 12 grams of Dijon mustard over the ham
Then add the remainding grate gruyere
Top with the second piece of bread
Top with Mornay and Cheese
Cover the top of each sandwich with the remaining Mornay sauce and sprinkle with the remaining grated Gruyère cheese
Bake the sandwiches in the preheated oven for approximately 10 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and golden brown
If you have a broiler setting, you can broil for the last couple minutes, watching close to prevent burning, for a nicely browned top
While the sandwiches are baking, add 15 grams of olive oil in a frying pan over medium heat
Carefully crack the 2 eggs into the pan and fry them sunny-side up, or to your desired doneness
Season with salt and pepper
Once the sandwiches are baked, place a fried egg on top of each sandwich
Enjoy
cooking tips: If the Mornay sauce becomes too thick, add a splash of warm milk to thin it out
Gruyère is the traditional cheese, but you can also use Comté or a combination of cheeses
A sturdy bread like sourdough or brioche holds up well to the sauce and toppings
Toast the bread lightly before assembling the sandwich to prevent it from becoming soggy
For perfectly round fried eggs, you can use a cooking ring
Feel free to add other ingredients like caramelized onions or mushrooms to your sandwich

queries.Eggs: Eggs, Grade A, Large, egg whole

Sunny Side Up.name: Sunny Side Up Egg
instructions: Heat a saucepan up to low heat
Add some butter or olive oil to the saucepan
Crack an egg into the saucepan
Use a spoon and scoop the butter or olive oil in the pan onto the egg yolk
Once the egg white is set, remove the egg from the saucepan
Add some salt and pepper
Enjoy
cooking tips: Add seasonings once the egg is finished cooking
Use a combination of butter and olive oil

queries.Eggs: Eggs, Grade A, Large, egg whole

Poached.name: Poached Egg
instructions: Bring a large pot of water to a boil, then reduce to low (or turn off the heat)
Crack the egg in a fine mesh sieve (over a small bowl) and remove the liquidy
Transfer the egg to a small ramekin or bowl
Add one tablespoon of light-colored vinegar to the pot and stir to create a vortex
Pour the ramekin with the egg into the middle of the vortex and set a timer for 3 minutes
Once the egg is done, use a slotted spoon to remove the poached egg. Dab with a paper towel to remove excess water and enjoy
cooking tips: Use a fresh egg
Use a deep pot

queries.Eggs: Eggs, Grade A, Large, egg whole

Shakshuka.name: Shakshuka
instructions: Heat 30 grams of olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat
Add 120 grams of finely chopped onion and sauté for about 3-4 minutes until softened
Stir in 10 grams of minced garlic and cook for another minute until fragrant
Add 150 grams of diced red bell pepper and sauté for 5-7 minutes until softened
Pour in 400 grams of crushed canned tomatoes and 30 grams of tomato paste, stirring well to combine
Season with 5 grams of ground cumin, 5 grams of paprika, 1 gram of cayenne pepper, 5 grams of salt, and 3 grams of black pepper
Simmer for 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the sauce thickens slightly
Make small wells in the sauce and crack 4 eggs (about 200 grams) into the wells
Cover and cook for 5-8 minutes until the egg whites are set but yolks remain slightly runny
Sprinkle with 50 grams of crumbled feta cheese and 15 grams of freshly chopped parsley
Enjoy with warm bread for dipping
cooking tips: For extra depth of flavor, let the sauce simmer longer before adding the eggs
If the sauce thickens too much, add a splash of water or vegetable broth to loosen it
Covering the pan while cooking the eggs helps them set more evenly
For a spicier shakshuka, increase the cayenne pepper or add chopped chili peppers
Serve with warm pita, sourdough, or crusty bread to soak up the sauce

queries.Eggs: Eggs, Grade A, Large, egg whole

Huevos Rancheros.name: Huevos Rancheros
instructions: Heat 30 grams of olive oil in a skillet over medium heat
Add 100 grams of finely chopped onion and sauté for about 3-4 minutes until softened
Stir in 10 grams of minced garlic and 1 diced jalapeño (about 20 grams), cooking for another minute until fragrant
Pour in 400 grams of crushed canned tomatoes and 20 grams of tomato paste, stirring to combine
Season with 5 grams of ground cumin, 5 grams of paprika, 5 grams of salt, and 3 grams of black pepper
Simmer for 10-12 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the sauce thickens
In a separate pan, heat 10 grams of olive oil over medium heat and lightly fry 4 corn tortillas (about 120 grams total) until golden and crispy. Set aside
Heat another 10 grams of olive oil and fry 4 eggs (about 200 grams total) to your preferred doneness
Warm 200 grams of refried beans and spread evenly over the fried tortillas
Spoon the tomato sauce over the beans, then top each with a fried egg
Garnish with 15 grams of freshly chopped cilantro
Enjoy
cooking tips: For a smokier flavor, roast the jalapeño and tomatoes before blending into the sauce
If you prefer a spicier sauce, add extra jalapeño or a dash of hot sauce
Use freshly made refried beans for the best flavor, or mix in a little lime juice for extra zest

queries.Eggs: Eggs, Grade A, Large, egg whole

Ovos Mexidos com Chorizo.name: Ovos Mexidos com Chorizo
instructions: Heat 20 grams of olive oil in a pan over medium heat
Add 100 grams of diced chorizo and cook for 3-4 minutes until it releases its oils and becomes crispy
Stir in 50 grams of finely chopped onion and cook until softened, about 2-3 minutes
Add 5 grams of minced garlic and sauté for another minute until fragrant
In a bowl, whisk 4 eggs (about 200 grams total) with 30 grams of whole milk, 3 grams of salt, and 2 grams of black pepper
Reduce heat to low and pour the egg mixture into the pan, stirring continuously to scramble
Cook gently until the eggs are just set but still soft, about 3-4 minutes
Remove from heat and sprinkle with 10 grams of freshly chopped parsley
Enjoy
cooking tips: Use a good-quality chorizo for the best flavor
For creamier scrambled eggs, cook them on low heat and stir gently
If you like a spicier version, try adding a pinch of smoked paprika or chili flakes
Serve with rustic bread
You can add a handful of grated cheese at the end for a richer dish

queries.Eggs: Eggs, Grade A, Large, egg whole

Chilaquiles con Huevos.name: Chilaquiles con Huevos
instructions: In a blender, combine 150 grams of chopped tomatoes, 50 grams of finely chopped onion, 5 grams of minced garlic, 1 sliced jalapeño, 200 ml of chicken broth, and 100 grams of tomato sauce. Blend until smooth
In a large skillet, heat 10 grams of vegetable oil over medium heat and pour in the blended sauce. Simmer for 5-7 minutes until slightly thickened
Season the sauce with 3 grams of salt and 2 grams of black pepper
Add the fried tortilla chips to the skillet and gently toss to coat them in the sauce. Cook for 2-3 minutes until they soften slightly but remain crisp
In a separate pan, heat 10 grams of oil and fry 2 eggs (about 100 grams total) to your preferred doneness, seasoning with salt and pepper
Serve the chilaquiles on a plate and top each portion with a fried egg
Garnish with 10 grams of chopped cilantro
Enjoy
cooking tips: If you prefer a spicier sauce, add more jalapeños or a pinch of cayenne pepper
For a richer flavor, roast the tomatoes, onions, and garlic before blending the sauce
You can also add shredded chicken or black beans for extra protein
Chilaquiles can be served with red or green sauce, depending on preference

queries.Eggs: Eggs, Grade A, Large, egg whole
queries.Queso fresco: Queso Fresco Fresh Crumbling cheese, queso fresco

Moqueca de Ovos.name: Moqueca de Ovos
instructions: Heat 30 grams of palm oil in a skillet over medium heat
Add 100 grams of diced onion and sauté for about 3-4 minutes until softened
Stir in 10 grams of minced garlic and 80 grams of diced bell pepper, cooking for another minute until fragrant
Add 200 grams of diced tomatoes and stir well
Pour in 250 grams of coconut milk, stirring to combine
Season with 5 grams of ground cumin, 5 grams of paprika, 5 grams of salt, and 3 grams of black pepper
Simmer for 10-12 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the sauce thickens
Crack 4 eggs (about 200 grams total) directly into the simmering sauce, covering the pan to let them poach for 5-7 minutes, or until the whites are set but the yolks remain runny
Drizzle with 10 grams of fresh lime juice for extra brightness
Garnish with 15 grams of freshly chopped cilantro
Serve hot with rice or toasted bread
Enjoy
cooking tips: For a deeper flavor, let the sauce simmer longer before adding the eggs
If you prefer a spicier moqueca, add a diced chili pepper or a pinch of red pepper flakes
Palm oil gives it a traditional Brazilian taste, but you can substitute with olive oil if unavailable

queries.Eggs: Eggs, Grade A, Large, egg whole

Feijao Tropeiro.name: Feijão Tropeiro
instructions: In a large skillet, heat 20 grams of olive oil over medium heat
Add 100 grams of diced bacon and cook until crispy, about 5 minutes
Stir in 150 grams of sliced chorizo sausage and cook for another 5 minutes until browned
Add 80 grams of chopped onion and sauté until translucent, about 3 minutes
Stir in 10 grams of minced garlic and cook for another minute
Push the ingredients to the side of the skillet and scramble 2 eggs (about 100 grams total) in the center until fully cooked
Add 300 grams of cooked pinto beans, stirring gently to combine
Season with 5 grams of salt and 3 grams of black pepper
Stir in 100 grams of cassava flour (farofa) to absorb excess moisture and add texture
Add 150 grams of chopped collard greens and cook for another 3 minutes until slightly wilted
Garnish with 10 grams of fresh chopped parsley before serving
Enjoy
cooking tips: For a more authentic taste, use traditional Brazilian linguiça sausage
Adjust the amount of cassava flour to your preference—more for a drier dish, less for a moister texture
Serve with white rice and grilled meat for a complete meal

queries.Eggs: Eggs, Grade A, Large, egg whole

Kefta Mkaouara.name: Kefta Mkaouara
instructions: In a bowl, mix 300 grams of ground beef or lamb with 50 grams of finely chopped onion, 10 grams of minced garlic, 10 grams of chopped parsley, 10 grams of chopped cilantro, 5 grams of ground cumin, 5 grams of paprika, 2 grams of cinnamon, 3 grams of black pepper, and 5 grams of salt
Shape the mixture into small meatballs, about 20 grams each
In a large skillet, heat 20 grams of olive oil over medium heat
Add 150 grams of chopped tomatoes and 30 grams of tomato paste, stirring to combine
Season the sauce with 3 grams of salt, 2 grams of black pepper, 3 grams of paprika, and 3 grams of cumin
Simmer the sauce for 10 minutes until slightly thickened
Gently add the meatballs to the sauce and cook for 15-20 minutes, occasionally stirring gently
Crack 2 eggs (about 100 grams total) on top of the simmering sauce and cover the skillet
Cook for 5 minutes, or until the eggs are set to your preference
Garnish with extra chopped parsley and cilantro before serving
Enjoy with crusty bread or couscous
cooking tips: For a richer sauce, let the tomatoes cook down longer before adding the meatballs
You can substitute lamb for beef to get a more traditional Moroccan flavor
Add a pinch of cayenne pepper for a spicier dish
Serve with warm flatbread or over couscous for a complete meal

queries.Eggs: Eggs, Grade A, Large, egg whole

Vegetable and Egg Tagine.name: Vegetable and Egg Tagine
instructions: In a large tagine or skillet, heat some oil over medium heat
Add 100 grams of finely chopped onion and 10 grams of minced garlic, sautéing until fragrant
Stir in 150 grams of chopped tomatoes, 100 grams of sliced carrots, 100 grams of sliced bell peppers, 100 grams of sliced zucchini, and 150 grams of diced potatoes
Season with 5 grams of ground cumin, 5 grams of paprika, 3 grams of turmeric, 3 grams of black pepper, and 5 grams of salt
Pour in 200 ml of vegetable broth and bring to a simmer
Cover and cook for 20-25 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the vegetables are tender
Crack 4 eggs (about 200 grams total) over the simmering vegetables
Cover and cook for another 5-7 minutes, or until the eggs are set to your preference
Garnish with 10 grams of chopped fresh parsley and 10 grams of chopped fresh cilantro
Serve hot with crusty bread or couscous
Enjoy
cooking tips: For a richer flavor, roast the vegetables slightly before adding them to the tagine
Adjust the spices according to your taste—add chili flakes for some heat
Use sweet potatoes instead of regular potatoes for a slightly sweeter variation
Serve with warm bread to soak up the delicious sauce

queries.Eggs: Eggs, Grade A, Large, egg whole

Huevos Divorciados.name: Huevos Divorciados
instructions: In a pan, heat 10 grams of vegetable oil over medium heat and fry 2 corn tortillas until slightly crispy. Set aside
In the same pan, fry 2 eggs (about 100 grams total) to your preferred doneness, seasoning with salt and pepper
Heat 100 grams of refried beans and spread them onto each tortilla
Place one fried egg on each tortilla
Pour 50 grams of red salsa over one egg and 50 grams of green salsa over the other egg
Garnish with 10 grams of finely chopped onion, 5 grams of minced garlic, 10 grams of chopped cilantro, and 40 grams of crumbled queso fresco
Serve with sliced avocado on the side
Enjoy
cooking tips: For a spicier version, add more jalapeño or a pinch of cayenne to the salsas
Use homemade red and green salsas for a fresher taste
Warm the tortillas before frying to prevent them from becoming too hard
Pair with black beans or rice for a more filling meal

queries.Eggs: Eggs, Grade A, Large, egg whole
queries.Queso fresco: Queso Fresco Fresh Crumbling cheese, queso fresco

Century Egg and Tofu.name: Century Egg and Tofu
instructions: Carefully remove 200 grams of silken tofu from its package and place it on a serving plate. Drain any excess liquid
Dice 2 eggs (about 100 grams total) into small pieces and spread them evenly over the tofu
In a small bowl, mix 15 ml of soy sauce, 5 ml of cider vinegar, 5 grams of minced garlic, 5 grams of minced ginger, 2 grams of white pepper, and 2 grams of salt
Drizzle the sauce mixture evenly over the tofu and eggs
Garnish with 10 grams of finely chopped green onion, 5 grams of chopped cilantro, 5 grams of sliced red chili, and 5 grams of sesame seeds
Serve chilled or at room temperature
Enjoy
cooking tips: For a smoother presentation, gently pat the tofu dry before plating
If you prefer a stronger flavor, let the tofu marinate in the sauce for 10 minutes before serving
Use toasted sesame seeds for extra aroma and crunch
Pair with steamed rice for a more filling meal

queries.Eggs: Eggs, Grade A, Large, egg whole
queries.Red chili: Peppers, sweet, red, frozen, chopped, boiled, drained, without salt

Egg Foo Young.name: Egg Foo Young
instructions: In a mixing bowl, beat 4 eggs (about 200 grams total) until smooth
Add 50 grams of bean sprouts, 20 grams of chopped green onions, 50 grams of sliced mushrooms, and 50 grams of cooked and chopped shrimp to the eggs
Season the mixture with 5 grams of soy sauce, 3 grams of oyster sauce, 2 grams of salt, and 2 grams of white pepper
Heat 10 grams of vegetable oil in a skillet over medium heat
Pour a portion of the egg mixture into the skillet, shaping it into a round patty. Cook for 2-3 minutes per side until golden brown and set. Repeat with remaining mixture
In a saucepan, mix 200 ml of chicken broth, 5 grams of soy sauce, 5 grams of oyster sauce, 5 grams of cornstarch, 5 grams of minced garlic, and 5 grams of minced ginger
Simmer the sauce for 2-3 minutes until thickened, stirring constantly
Drizzle the sauce over the cooked Egg Foo Young and serve hot
Enjoy
cooking tips: For a fluffier texture, beat the eggs until light and airy before mixing with other ingredients
You can replace shrimp with chicken, pork, or tofu for variation
Use a non-stick skillet to prevent sticking and ensure even cooking
For extra crispiness, pan-fry in a little more oil

queries.Eggs: Eggs, Grade A, Large, egg whole
queries.Bean sprouts: Mung beans, mature seeds, sprouted, cooked, boiled, drained, with salt

Quiche Lorraine.name: Quiche Lorraine
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C). Roll out the pie crust and fit it into a 9-inch (23 cm) pie dish. Prick the bottom with a fork and pre-bake for 10 minutes
In a skillet, cook 100 grams of chopped bacon over medium heat until crispy. Remove and drain on paper towels
In the same skillet, sauté 50 grams of finely chopped onion until soft and translucent
In a mixing bowl, whisk together 4 large eggs (about 200 grams), 200 ml of heavy cream, 100 ml of milk, 2 grams of salt, 1 gram of black pepper, and 1 gram of nutmeg
Spread the cooked bacon and onions evenly over the pre-baked crust, then sprinkle 100 grams of shredded Gruyère cheese on top
Pour the egg mixture over the ingredients in the crust
Bake for 35-40 minutes until the quiche is set and the top is golden brown
Let the quiche cool slightly before slicing and serving
Enjoy
cooking tips: Blind-bake the crust to prevent sogginess
For a richer flavor, use a mix of Gruyère and Parmesan cheese
Let the quiche cool for at least 10 minutes before slicing to allow it to set properly
Substitute bacon with smoked salmon or ham for variation

queries.Pie crust: Pie crust, standard-type, prepared from recipe, unbaked
queries.Eggs: Eggs, Grade A, Large, egg whole

Steamed Egg Custard.name: Steamed Egg Custard
instructions: In a mixing bowl, beat 3 large eggs (about 150 grams total) until smooth
Gradually add 300 ml of warm water while continuing to whisk gently
Season the mixture with 5 grams of soy sauce, 2 grams of salt, and 1 gram of white pepper
Strain the mixture through a fine sieve to remove air bubbles for a smoother texture
Pour the egg mixture into a heatproof bowl or ramekins
Cover the bowl with plastic wrap or foil to prevent condensation from dripping into the custard
Steam over medium-low heat for 10-15 minutes until the custard is just set
Drizzle with 5 grams of sesame oil and garnish with chopped green onions before serving
Enjoy
cooking tips: Use warm water instead of cold water for a silkier texture
Strain the egg mixture to remove air bubbles and ensure smooth custard
Cover the dish while steaming to prevent condensation from affecting the texture
Adjust steaming time based on container size and heat level

queries.Eggs: Eggs, Grade A, Large, egg whole

French Omelette.name: French Omelette
instructions: In a mixing bowl, beat 3 large eggs (about 150 grams total) until fully combined and slightly frothy
Season with 2 grams of salt and 1 gram of white pepper
Heat butter in a non-stick skillet over low heat until melted but not browned
Pour in the eggs and continuously stir with a spatula while shaking the pan to create small curds
Once the eggs begin to set but are still slightly runny, smooth out the surface and let them cook for another 10-15 seconds
If using, sprinkle fresh herbs or cheese onto the omelette before folding
Gently roll the omelette into a cylindrical shape and slide it onto a plate
Brush with an additional small amount of butter for a glossy finish before serving
Enjoy
cooking tips: Use low heat to prevent overcooking and achieve a tender texture
Continuously stir and shake the pan to create a smooth and creamy consistency
For extra creaminess, add a teaspoon of heavy cream or milk to the eggs before cooking
Use a rubber spatula to shape and fold the omelette gently

queries.Eggs: Eggs, Grade A, Large, egg whole

Avocado Toast.name: Avocado Toast
instructions: Toast 2 slices of bread until golden and crisp
Spread the guacamole evenly onto the toasted bread
Drizzle with 5 grams of olive oil and sprinkle red pepper flakes if desired
Bring a saucepan up to medim heat before adding in some butter or oil
Add in an egg and cook until the white is set
Top with fried egg for extra flavor and protein
Enjoy
cooking tips: Use ripe avocados for a creamy texture
Toast the bread until crisp to prevent sogginess
Add extra toppings like feta cheese, radishes, or microgreens for variety
For a tangy kick, add a splash of balsamic glaze

queries.Egg: Eggs, Grade A, Large, egg whole

Scrambled.name: Scrambled Eggs
instructions: Bring a saucepan up to low heat
Add in butter or oil to the saucepan
Whisk the eggs together in a mixing bowl
Pour the whisked eggs into the saucepan
Use a spatula to keep moving the eggs while also jiggling the saucepan
Once the eggs are only a litte watery, remove from heat and add desired seasongs
Enjoy
cooking tips: Move the saucepan and mix the eggs with spatula to keep the curdles small
Add salt to the eggs to bring out the flavor
Use a combination of olive oil and butter

queries.Eggs: Eggs, Grade A, Large, egg whole

Omelette.name: Classic Omelette
ingredients: Herbs (optional, such as parsley or chives)
instructions: In a bowl, beat 3 eggs (about 150 grams) with a pinch of salt, black pepper, and optionally some milk or cream
Heat butter or oil in a non-stick skillet over medium-low heat until melted
Pour the egg mixture into the pan, tilting to spread evenly
Use a spatula to gently stir the eggs while shaking the pan to allow uncooked eggs to reach the surface
Once the eggs begin to set but are still slightly runny on top, add 20 grams of cheese if using
Carefully fold the omelette in half and cook for another 30 seconds until fully set
Slide onto a plate and garnish with chopped herbs if desired. Serve immediately
cooking tips: Use fresh eggs for the best texture and flavor
Cook over medium-low heat to avoid overcooking
For a fluffier omelette, beat the eggs thoroughly before cooking
Add fillings like mushrooms, spinach, or ham for variety

queries.Eggs: Eggs, Grade A, Large, egg whole

Baked.name: Baked Eggs
ingredients: Cheese (optional, such as Parmesan or Gruyère)
Fresh herbs (optional, such as parsley or chives)
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Grease a small baking dish or ramekin with butter or olive oil
Crack 2 eggs (about 100 grams) into the dish and season with a pinch of salt and 1 gram of black pepper
Drizzle with 10 grams of heavy cream if using and sprinkle with 15 grams of cheese
Optionally, add 20 grams of chopped tomatoes or spinach for extra flavor
Bake for 12-15 minutes, or until the egg whites are set but the yolks are still slightly runny
Remove from oven and garnish with 5 grams of fresh herbs. Serve warm
cooking tips: Use fresh eggs for the best texture and flavor
Adjust baking time to achieve desired yolk consistency
Serve with toasted bread or a side salad for a complete meal
Experiment with different cheeses and toppings for variety

queries.Eggs: Eggs, Grade A, Large, egg whole

Deviled.name: Deviled Eggs
instructions: Place 6 eggs (about 300 grams total) in a pot and cover with water. Bring to a boil, then cover and remove from heat. Let sit for 12 minutes
Transfer eggs to an ice bath and let cool for 5 minutes. Peel and slice in half lengthwise
Remove the yolks and place them in a bowl. Mash with a fork until smooth
Add 50 grams of mayonnaise, 10 grams of Dijon mustard, 5 grams of white vinegar, 2 grams of salt, and 1 gram of black pepper to the yolks. Mix until creamy
Spoon or pipe the yolk mixture back into the egg whites
Sprinkle with paprika
Serve chilled
cooking tips: For easier peeling, use eggs that are at least a week old
Chill the filling before piping for better texture
Experiment with toppings like crispy bacon, pickles, or hot sauce
Use a piping bag for a more decorative presentation

queries.Eggs: Eggs, Grade A, Large, egg whole

Over Easy.name: Over Easy Eggs
instructions: Bring a saucepan up to low heat
Add oil or butter to the saucepan
Crack the egg into the saucepan
Once the white of the egg has set, flip the egg over
After 20-30 seconds remove the egg from the saucepan
Enjoy
cooking tips: Use fresh eggs to maximize flavor
Add desired seasonings to eggs before consuming them

queries.Eggs: Eggs, Grade A, Large, egg whole

Boiled.name: Boiled Eggs
instructions: Add egg to pot full of cold water
Bring the pot to a boil
Let eggs boil until desired doneness (6 minutes for soft boiled and 10 for hard boiled)
Remove eggs from pot and let them cool off
Enjoy
cooking tips: Use fresh eggs to maximize flavor
Put eggs in cold, ice water after boiling

queries.Eggs: Eggs, Grade A, Large, egg whole

Egg Fried Rice.name: Egg Fried Rice
instructions: Heat oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat
Add 2 beaten eggs (about 100 grams) and scramble until just set. Remove from the skillet and set aside
In the same skillet, add 5 grams of vegetable oil, 50 grams of diced carrots, 50 grams of peas, and 5 grams of minced garlic. Sauté for 2 minutes
Add 300 grams of cooked rice and stir-fry for 3-4 minutes
Return the scrambled eggs to the skillet and mix well
Season with 10 grams of soy sauce, 5 grams of sesame oil, salt, and black pepper
Stir in 20 grams of chopped green onions and serve hot
Enjoy
cooking tips: Use cold, day-old rice for the best texture
Stir-fry over high heat to prevent the rice from becoming mushy
Customize with protein like chicken, shrimp, or tofu

queries.Eggs: Eggs, Grade A, Large, egg whole

Eggs Benedict.name: Eggs Benedict
instructions: Toast 2 English muffin halves until golden brown
In a skillet, heat 2 slices (50 grams) of bacon until lightly browned. Place on the toasted muffins
Fill a saucepan with water, add white vinegar, and bring to a simmer
Crack 2 eggs (about 100 grams total) into separate cups and gently slide into the simmering water. Poach for 3-4 minutes, then remove with a slotted spoon
Place the poached eggs on top of the bacon
Season with 2 grams of salt and 1 gram of black pepper
Drizzle the hollandaise sauce over the eggs and serve immediately
cooking tips: Use fresh eggs for the best poaching results
Keep the water at a gentle simmer, not a rolling boil, to poach eggs properly
Whisk the hollandaise sauce constantly to prevent curdling

queries.Eggs: Eggs, Grade A, Large, egg whole

Sous Vide.name: Sous Vide Eggs
instructions: Set a precision cooker or sous vide machine to 165 F (74 C) in a pot of water
Once the water has reached the desired temperature, add the egg into the pot
After 15 minutes remove the egg from the pot
Let the egg rest for 3 minutes
Enjoy
cooking tips: Use fresh eggs to maximize flavor
Put eggs in cold, ice water after cooking

queries.Eggs: Eggs, Grade A, Large, egg whole
